text:
Julia is so concise.
I got a ton done today.
A massive PR to lay the foundation for a major new system component.
It is only 335 lines.

elements.text:
Julia is so concise.
I got a ton done today.
A massive PR to lay the foundation for a major new system component.
It is only 335 lines.

text:
yes, it is kinda unstatifying to look at a hard day’s work and see only 335 lines.
If i was writing Java i would have hit well over 1000 lines.
Maybe even 2000.

elements.text:
yes, it is kinda unstatifying to look at a hard day’s work and see only 335 lines.
If i was writing Java i would have hit well over 1000 lines.
Maybe even 2000.

text: In a big project, you can easily hit a couple hundred lines of Java just through the imports. It makes you look so productive!

elements.text: In a big project, you can easily hit a couple hundred lines of Java just through the imports. It makes you look so productive!

text: you also get a couple hundred more any time you copy-paste a "design pattern"  to compensate for not having higher order functions

elements.text: you also get a couple hundred more any time you copy-paste a "design pattern"  to compensate for not having higher order functions

text:
>  Needs more factories! :grin:
I would need to check my definitions, but I think it even has 2 factories.
Its just that that pattern in julia can be implemented in 1 line with a closure:
```foo_maker = x->Foo(x, y)```
How am i going to get my LOC up now :disappointed:

elements.text:
I would need to check my definitions, but I think it even has 2 factories.
Its just that that pattern in julia can be implemented in 1 line with a closure:
How am i going to get my LOC up now

text:
```julia> foo_maker =
           function (x)
               output = Foo(
                   x,
                   y
               )
               return output
           end```

elements.text:
julia> foo_maker =
           function (x)
               output = Foo(
                   x,
                   y
               )
               return output
           end
